intro: Eystathes, commonly known as the "ghost flower," is a rare and enigmatic plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its pale, almost translucent petals that resemble ghostly apparitions, giving it its ethereal appearance. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in temperate forest understories. Its unique morphology includes a slender stem and small, clustered flowers that bloom during the late spring or early summer. Due to its elusive nature and limited distribution, Eystathes is considered a rare and delicate botanical specimen.
